title: What is the music genre of following songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of them are pop, although like others have mentioned, these songs do have elements of other genres.Here are the ones I try to identify.. feedback are appreciated Infinite - Before the Dawn = dance-pop with a bit of rock (mainly because of the electric guitar)Infinite - Back = dance-pop and electropop, has a bit of spanish-latin (?) feel because of the acoustic guitarHenry - Trap = bubblegum popBeast - Shadow = electropop and dance-popBeast - Fiction = dance-popOneway - Magic = pop with elements of trap music and synthpopGirl's Day - Something = disco-dance music (popular back then)Winner - Empty = has elements of R&BSistar - Alone = pop with R&B touchEXO - Exodus = pop with R&B feel (I guess)EXO - Lady Luck = R&B, hip hopEXO - Hurt = R&B, electronicExo - Overdose = electronic dance music (EDM)Taemin - Play Me = R&BTroublemaker - Now = dance-popI think DBSK and SHINee's songs are both just pop. Quite hard to define what is EXO's Thunder, but I think also pop, just with a lot of sfx samples (like breaking glass sound).

For the most part, all of these are pop songs. They can pretty much all be considered Kpop, also, but some of the songs are sung in other languages. Replay by SHINee is sung in Korean as well as Japanese. Most, if not all, of EXO's music is also done in Mandarin. DBSK, when they were around, sung in Japanese and Mandarin if I'm not mistaken. I don't know them well enough to know which songs were sung in what. The rest of the groups and people on the list sing in Korean, or at least the ones that I recognize.  TL;DR the list contains Kpop, Jpop, and Mandpop as far as I know.
